lines.text: No, no. I regret to say the bitch is still going strong.
Alright, I'm sold. I'll sign on, for the duration.
On my terms? Equal shares for all?
Well, if you insist on this socialistic nonsense, yes. You're losing a friend, but gaining a second-in-command.
[playing a Brigadier inspecting the training camp in response to some private who has 'complained to his MP' regarding the food]
Carry on eating. Any complaints here?
Come along now. Answer the Brigadier.
You're, um, quite satisfied with the food. You can speak quite freely.
Well, er, no, Sir. Not always, Sir.
What exactly don't you like about it?
Well, er, they sometimes give you good grub, sir, but, er, they mess it about like.
How do you mean, mess it about?
Well, take Sunday, Sir. I mean, er, we had a fair whack of the old roast and that and gravy and stuff, but they messed it about like. You know.
What did they do to it?
Oh1 Oh, well, I'm not a cook am I? I only go by what I taste, like, and, er, it didn't taste right, see. It sort of tasted like they'd messed it about, like.
Well, that was only last Sunday, sir.
Oh, well, very fair, sir. You know, if you like eggs. I mean, they're not great favourites of mine, but, er, you've gotta eat them to keep your strength up, like.

[other privates at table congratulate worthy Grogan, clapping him on the back]
Well done, Rolly.
Well, bleedin' asked me, didn't he?
